TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CalendarSelectionMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies whether a single or multiple dates can be selected in a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar">.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property to F:System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode.MultipleRange?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True.
[!code-cs[CalendarSnippets#3](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/calendarsnippets/window1.xaml.cs#3)] [!code-xml[CalendarSnippets#3](../../add/codesnippet/Xaml/calendarsnippets_xaml/window1.xaml#3)] [!code-vb[CalendarSnippets#3](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/calendarsnippets_vb/window1.xaml.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode MultipleRange = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Multiple non-contiguous ranges of dates can be selected. Use the P:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property to retrieve the selected dates.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode None = int32(3)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode SingleDate = int32(0)

Docs.summary: A single date can be selected. Use the P:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDate?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property to retrieve the selected date.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Controls.CalendarSelectionMode SingleRange = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A single range of dates can be selected. Use the P:System.Windows.Controls.Calendar.SelectedDates?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True property to retrieve the selected dates.
